titles.title: Modoc National Forest Boundary Adjustment Act

To expand the boundary of the Modoc National Forest to include lands presently owned by the Bank of California, N.A. Trustee, to facilitate a land exchange with the Forest Service, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Lands.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 104-307.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 159.

action.text: Mr. Cooley moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Referred to Subcommittee on Forests and Public Lands.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

bill.summary: 5/9/1995--Introduced. Modoc National Forest Boundary Adjustment Act - Modifies the boundary of the Modoc National Forest to include and encompass specified lands owned by the Bank of California, N.A. Trustee. Considers the boundary of the Forest, as modified by this Act, to be that boundary as of January 1, 1965, for purposes of Land and Water Conservation Fund provisions.
